page.description: Run a program and wait until the program closes before returning.
page.prototype: V sys_shell_wait(C command_line [,L show_window [, N timeout [, L terminateOnTimeout]]])

argument.name: command_line
argument.description: The Windows command that you wish to run.

argument.name: show_window
argument.description: Default = .T. If .T., Display window. If .F., Hide window.

argument.name: timeout
argument.description: Default = -1. Length in milliseconds to wait before timing out. -1 = INFINITE.

argument.name: terminateOnTimeout
argument.description: Default = .F.. If a timeout occurs and this parameter is set to true, the created process will be terminated using a pattern that injects a thread into the new process and calls Exit Process. This is to prevent handles from remaining locked. Kill process (TerminateProcess()) does not release handles gracefully.

page.note: SYS_SHELL_WAIT() does not throw any errors if something fails.
page.discussion: The SYS_SHELL_WAIT() function runs a command and waits until it is completed before returning control to Alpha Anywhere.

important.p: When used in web or mobile applications, you *[cannot]* run any programs with *[xb:SYS_SHELL_WAIT()]* that require user input. *[xb:SYS_SHELL_WAIT()]* is executed on the Application Server in web and mobile applications, and the user cannot interact with the script.
